reference.title: Create Key dialog
reference.shortdesc: Allows you to create a new self-signing key for use when signing Android packages (APKs). Contains fields for the key name (its "alias"), for each of the components of a distinguished name (DN; used to identify the creator of a key pair or certificate) and for a password used to protect the key.

section.p: This dialog is displayed when you select a keystore and then click (Create Key) in the Signing and Keys view. The new key will be placed in the selected keystore.
You must supply a value for each of the starred (*) form fields in order to generate the public-private key pair.

strow.stentry: A unique name to be given to this key pair. Key pairs are identified by alias within the keystore.
The name of the company you are working for.
The company branch or division you are working for.
The full name of your city or locality. For instance, "New York".
Your state or province. This should be a full name. For instance, "California".
Select your country from the list.
How long (in years) the certificate should be considered valid.

A password that protects this key. You must supply this password when you use this key to sign an Android package. Note that if you select Save this password, MOTODEV Studio will remember the password and supply it for you when you use this key to sign a package.
Enter the key password again, to confirm that what you entered is what you intended.

Select this option if you want MOTODEV Studio to automatically supply the password when you sign packages with this key. Leave this option unselected if you want MOTODEV Studio to prompt for the password each time this key is used.
